DataElement.preferredName: Substance Administration Intervention or Procedure Reuse Template Study Activity Repeat Frequency Ratio ISO21090.RTO.INT,PQ.TIME.v1.0
DataElement.preferredDefinition: An activity defined at a global library level that is an action of applying, dispensing or otherwise giving medications or other substances. EXAMPLE(S): Administration of methotrexate as part of chemotherapy. A ratio representing the number of occurrences of an activity within a given time period. EXAMPLE(S): Once per 12 hours; 2 times per day

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Substance Administration Intervention or Procedure Reuse Template Study Activity Repeat Frequency Ratio
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A material with particular features.:The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering of something to another, such as administration of a medicine.:An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects.:To use again.:Something that establishes or serves as a pattern for reference; a form, mold, or pattern used as a guide to making something.:A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.:An action taken in pursuit of an objective._Make or do or perform again.:The number of occurrences of something within a given time period.:Quotient of quantities of the same kind for different components within the same system.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Substance Administration Intervention or Procedure Reuse Template Study Activity
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A material with particular features.:The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering of something to another, such as administration of a medicine.:An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects.:To use again.:Something that establishes or serves as a pattern for reference; a form, mold, or pattern used as a guide to making something.:A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.:An action taken in pursuit of an objective.

Concepts.definition: Any matter of defined composition that has discrete existence, whose origin may be biological, mineral or chemical.
The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering of something to another, such as administration of a medicine.

An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects.
Something that establishes or serves as a pattern for reference; a form, mold, or pattern used as a guide to making something.
A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.
An active process; excludes processes and mechanisms which fulfill biological functions.

Property.preferredDefinition: Make or do or perform again.:The number of occurrences of something within a given time period.:Quotient of quantities of the same kind for different components within the same system.

Concepts.definition: Make or do or perform again.
The number of occurrences of something within a given time period.
Quotient of quantities of the same kind for different components within the same system.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Default Conceptual Domain for UML Loader

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: DEC released per model owner approval. mc 2/2/11

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Quantity quotient of a numerator of type INT divided by a denominator of type PQ.TIME.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Health Informatics - Harmonized data types for information interchange

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification.

Concepts.definition: A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.
